intro: Boronia pulchella, commonly known as the sweet pepper plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spherical inflorescences and bloom in spring. Boronia pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant scent.
